intro: Lachenalia framesii, commonly known as the Orange River lachenalia, is a striking bulbous plant native to South Africa. It features tall, slender stems with clustered, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange-red. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, underground bulbs that store water. Lachenalia framesii typically blooms in summer, producing showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
